cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tangrowth
cards.text: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Hoppip
cards.text: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

cards.name: Skiploom
cards.text: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.

cards.name: Jumpluff
cards.text: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.

attacks.name: Fluffy Transport
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Step
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of your remaining Prize cards.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Yanmega

abilities.name: Sonic Vision
abilities.text: If you have exactly 4 cards in your hand, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

cards.text: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Assault Boom
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Yanmega BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Yanmega BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Barrier Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Seedot
cards.text: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, if this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's next turn, it is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

cards.name: Nuzleaf
cards.text: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

cards.name: Shiftry
cards.text: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.

attacks.name: Wicked Wind
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Stadium or Pokémon Tool card in play has no effect. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Foongus

abilities.name: Play Ball
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 3 Poké Ball cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.text: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.

cards.name: Amoonguss
cards.text: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

attacks.name: Crazy Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Strange Reaction
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Confused, it is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Larvesta
cards.text: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

cards.name: Volcarona
cards.text: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

attacks.name: Shimmering Scales
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Power Hurricane
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.

attacks.name: Returning Flames
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Rapidash
cards.text: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Monferno
cards.text: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

cards.name: Infernape
cards.text: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Up
attacks.text: If you have fewer than 10 Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, this attack does nothing. Shuffle 10 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Talonflame BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Talonflame BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Litleo
cards.text: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Pyroar
cards.text: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Incinerate
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Pyroar BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Pyroar BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Kaiser Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Volcanion
cards.text: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

attacks.name: Power Heater
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to each of those Pokémon.

cards.name: Volcanion-EX

abilities.name: Steam Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.name: Mantine
cards.text: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

attacks.name: Healing Wave
attacks.text: Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shellos
cards.text: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

cards.name: Gastrodon
cards.text: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.

attacks.name: Sticky Shot
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Oshawott
cards.text: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

cards.name: Dewott
cards.text: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Samurott
cards.text: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

attacks.name: Ultimate Blade
attacks.text: If the damage from this attack reduces your opponent's Active Pokémon's HP to 60 or less, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Pike
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Clauncher
cards.text: Through controlled expulsions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

attacks.name: Double Pincers
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Clawitzer

abilities.name: Mega Boost
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Special Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Mega Evolution Pokémon.

cards.text: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

cards.name: Clawitzer BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Clawitzer BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Lock-On
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn. During your next turn, any damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is increased by 120 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Bergmite
cards.text: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

attacks.name: Ice Block
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Avalugg
cards.text: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back make it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Melting Floe
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. For each Water Energy card you discarded in this way, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Flaaffy
cards.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Ampharos

abilities.name: Shocking Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-EX.

cards.text: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Joltik
cards.text: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

cards.name: Galvantula
cards.text: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

attacks.name: Double Thread
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.

attacks.name: Come Along
attacks.text: Search your deck for Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

attacks.name: Nido Press
attacks.text: If Nidorina is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: King's Palace
abilities.text: Your Nidoqueen's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

attacks.name: Power Lariat
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Evolution Pokémon on your Bench.

cards.name: Drifloon
cards.text: These Pokémon are called the "Signpost for Wandering Spirits." Children holding them sometimes vanish.

attacks.name: Transfer Pain
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Drifblim
cards.text: It's drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Burst Curse
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. Put 8 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.text: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

attacks.name: Slightly Simmer
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and discard them. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Lampent
cards.text: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

attacks.name: Mirror Mirror
attacks.text: Each player either draws or discards cards until that player has 4 cards in his or her hand. (Your opponent does this first.)

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Sinister Selection
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.

cards.text: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

attacks.name: Past Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile.

cards.name: Hoopa
cards.text: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

attacks.name: Hyperspace Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Portal Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Portal Strike during your next turn.

cards.name: Mankey
cards.text: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Flop attack's base damage is 50.

cards.name: Primeape
cards.text: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spirited Throw
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has more remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Nosepass
cards.text: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Probopass
cards.text: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

attacks.name: Bounce Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Anorith

abilities.name: Restored Barrier
abilities.text: Each of your Restored Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.text: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Armaldo
cards.text: Protected by a hard shell, its body is very sturdy. It skewers prey with its claws to feed.

attacks.name: Rushing Water
attacks.text: Move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Poison Up
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, put 3 more damage counters on that Pokémon between turns. This effect can be applied more than once.

cards.name: Toxicroak

abilities.name: Poison Enzyme
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon.

cards.text: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Sneasel
cards.text: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.

attacks.name: Nyan Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Tear Away
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

cards.text: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

cards.name: Spiritomb
cards.text: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Damage Play
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Pawniard
cards.text: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

attacks.name: Charge Order
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pawniard.

cards.name: Bisharp
cards.text: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Yveltal
cards.text: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

attacks.name: Oblivion Wing
attacks.text: Attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkness Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Yveltal BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Yveltal BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Baleful Night
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Steelix-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Edge
attacks.text: You may do 50 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: M Steelix-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Canyon Axe
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Shieldon
cards.text: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

attacks.name: Rock Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Bastiodon
cards.text: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

attacks.name: Counter Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fortress of Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Klink
cards.text: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

attacks.name: Disorderly Flip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Klang
cards.text: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

attacks.name: Disorderly Flip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Klinklang

abilities.name: Heavy Bumper
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

attacks.name: Gear Spinner
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Gear Spinner attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Cobalion
cards.text: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Guard
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. This Pokémon can't use Quick Guard during your next turn.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Magearna-EX

abilities.name: Mystic Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon that has any Metal Energy attached to it. (Existing effects are not removed.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Soul Blaster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Soul Blaster attack's base damage is 60.

cards.name: Marill
cards.text: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Azumarill
cards.text: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Gardevoir-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Luminous Blade
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: M Gardevoir-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Despair Ray
attacks.text: Discard as many of your Benched Pokémon as you like. This attack does 10 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Klefki

abilities.name: Wonder Lock
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to this Pokémon and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. Prevent any damage done to the Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Mega Evolution Pokémon. If this card is attached to a Pokémon, discard this card at the end of your opponent's turn.

cards.text: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

cards.name: Xerneas
cards.text: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

attacks.name: Geomancy
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Fairy Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rainbow Spear
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Xerneas BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Xerneas BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Life Stream
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Druddigon
cards.text: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

attacks.name: Proud Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon BREAK in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Deino
cards.text: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Zweilous
cards.text: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Power Breath
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Hydreigon
cards.text: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

attacks.name: Cruel Fang
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dark Burn
attacks.text: Discard as many Darkness Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Darkness Energy you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Hydreigon BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Hydreigon BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Calamity Blast
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

attacks.name: Stall
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Persian
cards.text: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Meowth during this turn, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Aipom
cards.text: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.

attacks.name: Fiddle Around
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back in any order.

cards.name: Ambipom
cards.text: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

attacks.name: Furry Chance
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If that card is an Energy card, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Braviary
cards.text: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Sky Drop
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage minus 20 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Fletchling
cards.text: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it's merciless to intruders that enter its territory.

cards.name: Fletchinder
cards.text: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

cards.name: Talonflame

abilities.name: Gale Wings
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down as your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.

attacks.name: Aero Blitz
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Hawlucha

abilities.name: Sudden Cyclone
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Armor Fossil Shieldon
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Shieldon you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Captivating Poké Puff
cards.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Put any number of Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Claw Fossil Anorith
cards.text: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Anorith you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Gardevoir Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gardevoir-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Greedy Dice
cards.text: You can play this card only if you took it as a face-down Prize card, before you put it into your hand.,Flip a coin. If heads, take 1 more Prize card.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ninja Boy
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and switch it with that Pokémon. (Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle the first Pokémon into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Ranger
cards.text: Remove all effects of attacks on each player and his or her Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Special Charge
cards.text: Shuffle 2 Special Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Steelix Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Steelix-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Volcanion-EX

abilities.name: Steam Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Steelix-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Edge
attacks.text: You may do 50 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 100 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: M Steelix-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Canyon Axe
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Magearna-EX

abilities.name: Mystic Heart
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon that has any Metal Energy attached to it. (Existing effects are not removed.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Soul Blaster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Soul Blaster attack's base damage is 60.

cards.name: Gardevoir-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Luminous Blade
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: M Gardevoir-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Despair Ray
attacks.text: Discard as many of your Benched Pokémon as you like. This attack does 10 more damage for each Benched Pokémon you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Pokémon Ranger
cards.text: Remove all effects of attacks on each player and his or her Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Professor Sycamore
cards.text: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, during this turn, your Basic Fire Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 70 more damage.
